title: The Ring 4K Blu-Ray Box Set Is Only $39 At Amazon
description: The Ring Collection on 4K Blu-ray $39 (was $90) See at Amazon The Ring Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $19 (was $35) | All-time low See at Amazon Ringu 4-Film Collection: Special Edition (Blu-ray) $46.69 (was $100) | All-time low See at Amazon Fans of horror movies revolving around cursed VHS tapes and half-human, half-demon ghosts who crawl out of televisions can score a fantastic deal on The Ring Collection. Released last year with a $90 retail price, the three-film 4K Blu-ray box set is on sale for only $39 at Amazon. This is a new all-time low for The Ring Collection, which you'll need if you want to watch The Ring 2 and Rings on 4K Blu-ray; neither sequel has received a standalone 4K release. If you only want the first (and best) film in the series, The Ring Limited Edition Steelbook is discounted to only $19 (was $35), which is the lowest price yet and actually slightly cheaper than the standard edition 4K Blu-ray ($20.29). And if you're interested in comparing the Hollywood version of The Ring to the original Japanese film, Arrow Video's 4K Blu-ray restoration of Ringu is available for $35 (was $50). Alternatively, the Ringu 4-Film Collection is discounted to $46.69, which is an all-time low for this Blu-ray box set. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Gibson SG Wireless Guitar Controller For PS5 Launches This Month
description: CRKD Gibson SG Wireless Guitar Controller (PS5, PS4, PC) $135 | Releases December 19 Preorder at Amazon Amazon has opened preorders for CRKD's next Gibson Guitar Controller. The Gibson SG 20th Anniversary Edition retails for $135 and is slated to launch December 19. Notably, this is the first wireless guitar controller in CRKD's catalog licensed by PlayStation. The Gibson SG syncs wirelessly to PS5, PS4, PS3, and PC via a 2.4GHz dongle. The multiplatform version of CRKD's Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller is limited to a wired connection on PS5 and PS4, so the Gibson SG is likely the better option for Fortnite Festival and Rock Band 4 players on PlayStation. PS5 players now have two officially licensed wireless guitar controllers to choose from. The other is the PDP Riffmaster, which is still on sale for its $110 (was $150) Black Friday price. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: One Of 2025's Weirdest Films Comes To 4K Blu-Tay This Month
description: Bugonia Collector's Edition Steelbook (4K) $38 | Releases December 23 See at Amazon See at Walmart Bugonia Standard Edition $33 | Releases December 23 See at Amazon See at Walmart Between the usual superhero action and sleeper hits at the box office, one of the more unusual films released this year was Bugonia. The new thriller from director Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone--who also stars in the film alongside Jesse Plemons--wasn't a box office hit, but it's certainly an unforgettable movie. If you missed it when it came out, you can preorder it now ahead of its December 23 release, with options for a limited-edition 4K Blu-ray, standard 4K Blu-ray, standard Blu-ray, and DVD. Bugonia Collector's Edition Steelbook (4K) $38 | Releases December 23 The Collector's Edition steelbook cover uses Bugonia's theatrical posters for its exterior and interior artwork, which hint at the film's weird, conspiratorial tone. Like other Blu-ray releases, you'll get the film on a 4K Blu-ray disc, a standard Blu-ray disc, and a digital streaming code to watch it online. For bonus features, the Blu-ray includes a documentary on the making of Bugonia, interviews with the cast and crew, behind-the-scenes footage, and more. Bugonia bonus materials The Birth and the Bees: The making of Bugonia Interviews with Emma Stone, Jesse Plemons, and the rest of the cast and crew Behind-the-scenes footage featuring the sets, music, and cinematography See at Amazon See at Walmart Bugonia Standard Edition $33 | Releases December 23 The Bugonia standard edition features different cover art and a standard movie case, but includes the same special features as the steelbook edition. It's available to preorder in 4K, Blu-ray, and DVD formats at Amazon and Walmart, all of which launch on December 23. Bugonia Standard Edition Preorders: 4K -- $33 | Also at Walmart | Releases December 23 Blu-ray -- $31 | Also at Walmart | Releases December 23 DVD -- $18 | Also at Walmart | Releases December 23 See at Amazon See at Walmart Bugonia Collector's Edition Steelbook 4K Blu-rayBugonia is an adaptation of the 2003 South Korean sci-fi comedy film Save the Green Planet. The film follows two conspiracy-obsessed cousins (Plemons and Aidan Dobis) who are convinced that the CEO of a powerful company (Stone) is actually an alien in disguise, hellbent on wiping out humanity. After kidnapping and trapping her in their basement, the trio engages in a battle of wits, interrogation, and torture, with the film becoming increasingly unpredictable as it races towards its conclusion. While it wasn't a box-office hit, Bugonia did earn relatively high praise from critics and audiences alike thanks to the standout performances of the cast and its wild plot twists. For more Blu-ray deals, you can check out various specials right now. The Hobbit Trilogy on 4K Blu-ray has gotten a big discount, and the box set for the A Better Tomorrow Trilogy has also gotten a substantial price cut. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Check Out Wicked: For Good Limited-Edition 4K Blu-Rays
description: Wicked: For Good Gift Set $230 | Release date TBD See at Amazon Wicked: For Good Limited-Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $38 | Release date TBD See at Walmart Wicked: For Good Standard Edition $40.49 | Release date TBD See at Amazon (4K) See at Amazon (Blu-ray) See at Amazon (DVD) Wicked: For Good is coming to Blu-ray after it finishes its box office run, and fans can look forward to multiple limited-edition versions, along with standard Blu-ray and DVD versions, all of which are available to preorder now. The most extravagant release is the Amazon-exclusive Wicked: For Good Gift Set, available for $230, which includes the film on 4K Blu-ray and a selection of exclusive collectibles. Walmart also has its own exclusive Wicked: For Good Steelbook Edition 4K Blu-ray--though this one is much more affordable at $38. You can check out all the Wicked: For Good Blu-ray preorders below--just note that there are no release dates announced yet. Nevertheless, ordering ahead of time locks you in for Amazon and Walmart's preorder price guarantees. Wicked: For Good Gift Set $230 | Release date TBD The Wicked: For Good Gift Set includes the film on 4K Blu-ray with exclusive packaging. The cover features the witches Elphaba and Glinda standing opposite each other on the Yellow Brick Road, and on the inside, you'll find that motif repeated with promotional artwork from the film. The gift set also comes with a collectible gold Emerald City statuette and certificate of authenticity, all bundled up inside of an Emerald City-inspired pink box with gold metal highlights. At the time of writing, special features for the Blu-ray release have not been revealed yet, but if the first Wicked movie is any indication, you can likely expect featurettes, interviews, deleted scenes, and a sing-along mode so that you can take part in the musical. This version includes a standard Blu-ray copy of the film and a digital streaming code. See at Amazon Wicked: For Good Limited-Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $38 | Release date TBD Exclusive to Walmart, the Wicked: For Good Limited-Edition Steelbook 4K Blu-ray features images from Wicked: For Good's promotional materials on the front and back, while the inside of the case features an aerial view of Oz and the Emerald City. This version includes a 4K UHD, standard Blu-ray, and digital streaming copies of the film. See at Walmart Wicked: For Good Standard Edition $40.49 | Release date TBD Wicked: For Good will also be available in a standard edition that includes the movie and special features. Final artwork for the cover has not yet been revealed. Preorders are available for the 4K UHD, standard Blu-ray, and DVD versions. Wicked: For Good Standard Edition Preorders: 4K -- $40.49 Blu-ray -- $25 DVD -- $20 See at Amazon (4K) See at Amazon (Blu-ray) See at Amazon (DVD) Set after the events of the previous film, Wicked: For Good concludes the untold story of the witches of Oz. Elphaba and Glinda have now drifted apart and live drastically different lives. Elphaba has been forced into exile after being demonized as The Wicked Witch of the West, but she's still focused on her mission to expose the Wonderful Wizard of Oz. Meanwhile, Glinda has become a glamorous symbol of Goodness and is basking in the limelight, but both witches must eventually unite and reconcile their differences for the greater good of Oz. Wicked limited-edition steelbook Blu-rayIf you haven't seen it yet, the first Wicked movie is also available on 4K Blu-ray. Amazon has a fresh stock of the 4K steelbook edition, and both editions come with theatrical and sing-along versions of the film, deleted scenes, and behind-the-scenes documentaries. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Is Adding Hoenn Starter Mega Stones As Ranked Rewards
description: The Pokemon Company has revealed the next slate of Ranked Battle rewards coming to Pokemon Legends: Z-A. Players will have a chance to earn Mega Stones for the Hoenn starter Pokemon--Sceptile, Swampert, and Blaziken--during the next few seasons of the game's online multiplayer mode. Like other special Mega Stones, these elusive items are not otherwise obtainable in the game, so you'll need to participate in Ranked Battles if you want to snag them. Sceptilite will be available during Season 5; Swampertite will be distributed during Season 6; and Blazikenite can be earned during Season 7. As before, you'll need to hit a certain rank before the season ends to earn the Mega Stones. Previous rewards, such as the Mega Stones for Chesnaught, Delphox, and Greninja, were distributed upon reaching rank S. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Tron: Ares Is Getting A Steelbook Edition 4K Blu-Ray
description: The third entry in Disney's cult-classic sci-fi franchise, Tron: Ares, premiered in theaters earlier this year. The film expands the franchise's mythos with a new story centered on the titular Ares (Jared Leto), a self-aware artificial being who manages to exit the virtual reality of Tron and enter the real world. If you missed it, or you're already a fan and want to add it to your collection, preorders are now live for the Tron: Ares Blu-ray, which releases on January 6, 2026. The film will launch in multiple formats, including a limited-edition steelbook version that you can preorder for $45 at Amazon. Standard edition 4K Blu-ray, regular Blu-ray, and DVD versions are also available. Tron: Ares Limited-Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) $45 | Releases January 6, 2026 The steelbook edition features artwork of the film's primary cast on the front, and the stylish teaser poster for Tron: Ares on the rear. On the inside, you'll find a screenshot from the movie pulled from the action-packed lightcycle chase scene. The movie supports Dolby Atmos and HDR10, and it includes a selection of featurettes that examine the production of Tron: Ares. Director Joachim Rønning and star Jared Leto appear in several of these short documentaries to talk about their passion for the Tron franchise, and several deleted scenes are also included. See at Amazon See at Walmart Tron: Ares (4K Blu-ray) $50 - 30 | Releases January 6, 2026 The regular 4K edition features a cover based on the Tron: Ares poster that featured a gravity-defying lightcycle ride up a skyscraper. This version includes the same special features as the steelbook edition, along with the aforementioned standard Blu-ray and digital copies of the movie. Along with these 4K editions, the Tron: Ares standard Blu-ray and DVD versions are also available to preorder. See at Amazon See at Walmart Tron 3-Movie Collection (DVD) $35 | Releases January 6, 2026 All three Tron movies will also be released as a bundle, but the strange thing is that this collection is only on DVD. The DVD listing doesn't mention special features either, so it looks like this will likely be a film-only release. See at Amazon See at Walmart Tron: Ares 4K steelbook editionTron: Ares Special Features The Journey to Tron: Ares Jared Leto, director Joachim Rønning, and other cast and crew members reveal how Tron: Ares was made Lightcycles on the loose Rønning goes behind the scenes on one of the most action-packed sequences in the film The Artistry of Tron: Ares Rønning and Leto unpack key moments from Tron: Ares Cast conversations Candid conversations with the cast as they reflect on their time filming Tron: Ares The legacy of Tron A deep dive into how the older films influenced Tron: Ares Deleted scenes Seth's Date Burning Man Lisberger Cameo Released earlier this year, Tron: Ares was a box office bomb. The movie grossed only $142 million worldwide and received lukewarm critical reception at best. Audience reviews have been kinder, and while the film may not have reached the same heights as the original Tron or 2010's Tron: Legacy, there is still appreciation for how it pushes the franchise's concepts further and for its hard-hitting Nine Inch Nails soundtrack. Unlike the Tron movies, which were set on the digital frontier of the Grid, Tron: Ares explores the ramifications of that world crossing over into ours. Centered around Ares, a highly sophisticated Program, the movie chronicles the first meeting between humanity and digital AI beings. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Call Of Duty Will No Longer Do Back-To-Back Black Ops Or Modern Warfare Games
description: Activision is making a major strategic shift with the Call of Duty series that will affect it for years to come. Following the less-than-stellar response to Black Ops 7, the franchise will no longer get back-to-back entries in the same sub-series. This applies not only to Black Ops, but also to Modern Warfare. "We will no longer do back-to-back releases of Modern Warfare or Black Ops games," Activision said in the official announcement. "The reasons are many, but the main one is to ensure we provide an absolutely unique experience each and every year." Alongside this announcement, Activision promised "meaningful, not incremental" innovation for the series' future. It didn't specify exactly what this would mean, instead stressing it would share more "when the time is right." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: How To Complete All Warzone Easter Eggs On Haven's Hollow And Unlock All Rewards
description: Season 1 of Black Ops 7 adds the new Haven's Hollow map to Call of Duty: Warzone, and this quaint West Virginia town holds a lot of secrets to uncover. This includes six separate Easter eggs to complete for rewards, and there's a final super Easter egg reward for completing them all. In this guide, we'll walk you through how to complete all the Easter eggs on Haven's Hollow and earn every reward. There are six Easter eggs that you can complete on Haven's Hollow, and while these can all be completed solo, two of them can become complicated without the help of teammates. The Easter eggs and rewards are as follows: Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Games Weren't A Big Part Of Netflix's Attempted WB Takeover
description: Last week, Netflix put forth an $82 million deal to purchase Warner Bros. Studios, one of the biggest movie and TV studios in the world. Warner Bros. also has a considerable place in the video game industry with franchises like Batman, Harry Potter, and Mortal Kombat under its domain. However, one Netflix executive has now acknowledged that Warner Bros.' gaming division wasn't a significant factor in considering its bid. During a Netflix conference call about the potential WB sale, co-CEO Gregory K. Peters expressed some eagerness to exploit the video game franchises under Warner Bros. in the future. But he added that the games were "relatively minor" in the company's initial plans and that it may be "worth going back again to sort of how we thought about the deal and building our valuation model." "While they definitely have been doing some great work in the game space, we actually didn’t attribute any value to that from the get-go because they're relatively minor compared to the grand scheme of things," continued Peters. "Now we are super excited because some of those properties that they've built--[Hogwarts Legacy] is a great example of that--have been done quite well, and we think that we can incorporate that into what we're offering. They've got great studios and great folks working there. So we think that there's definitely an opportunity there. But just to be clear, we haven't built that into our deal model." Continue Reading at GameSpot
